title: Entree #1

content: im going to write here i dont know what to write im not going to edit entrees once the day has passed - whatever time zone i may be in

title: Entree #2
quote of the day: pork: 'no im like tossing 'sense' onto the ground and pointing it out'
content:
pork is like an alternative universe version of me the version of myself that speaks to me if 16 year old me could speak to me now.
 I work at a golf course to understand rich people; I do debate i out aura them; im leagues beyond my peers; im persistent and smart from a young age; etc;
 if you dont need people than stop needing them
 as edward put it 'dont really on the sunk cost fallacy'.
 this is simple shit i do know but i forget a lot. but again dont be too hard on yourself. consistent effort is 100 times more powerful than a single larger push

title: Entree #3
quote of the day: constraints are more powerful than goals
content: antigoals are as important if not more important than goals. people work better when they work freely within a constrained system rather than in a single direction. its impossible to know where to go in an ever evolving world so constraints - even if artificial and arbitrary allow for more novel solutions to emerge than the hyper specificity of a single goal
